educations.schoolName: Community College of the Air Force

headline: 287(g) Field Program Manager-Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Employed as an ICE Headquarters 287(g) Program Manager with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement in New Jersey.  Responsible for legal research to support decisions on deportation/exclusion cases and assist attorneys in representing the government in court actions. Supervise a Staff of 287(g) Designated Immigration Officers from; Monmouth, Salem and Cape May Counties. These officers have full Immigation authority and work with other federal law enforcement officials to identify, locate and arrest aliens and are responsible for ensuring the physical removal of aliens from the United States. Responsible for the preparation, present and defend deportation or exclusion proceedings. 

This work involves supervision of criminal aliens at various stages of their deportation/exclusion proceedings. Additional responsibilities include conducting complex investigations, conducting surveillance work, preparing investigative reports and assisting in seizures. Supervises enforcement functions related to the investigation, identification, arrest, prosecution, detention and deportation of aliens, and the apprehension of absconders from removal proceedings.

positions.description: Currently assigned to the Newark Field Office-Criminal Alien Program
positions.title: 287(g) Program Manager/Supervisory Deportation Officer
